title: Arco Automatico vs Arco Studio
comparison_headline: Convenience or craft — what matters more to you?
comparison_intro: These two machines sit at similar price points but represent fundamentally different philosophies. The Automatico handles everything from grinding to extraction with one touch. The Studio hands you full control and expects you to learn how to use it. Neither approach is wrong — they serve different people.
hero_image_alt: Arco Automatico and Arco Studio espresso machines in a split-screen composition, the Automatico in a bright modern kitchen with a clean uncluttered counter, the Studio in a dedicated coffee corner surrounded by grinder and accessories, visual contrast between simplicity and craft

boiler_type.product_a: Thermoblock with integrated conical burr grinder
boiler_type.product_b: Dual boiler with saturated group head (brass throughout)

pressure_control.product_a: Automatic pressure management — machine optimises extraction
pressure_control.product_b: Adjustable OPV + manual pre-infusion lever (0–9 bar ramp)

steam_capability.product_a: Automatic milk system — select drink type and it textures to the right consistency
steam_capability.product_b: Manual articulating steam wand — full control but requires technique

grind_compatibility.product_a: Built-in grinder with 5 grind settings — no separate grinder needed
grind_compatibility.product_b: Requires a separate grinder (Preciso minimum, Zero recommended)

suitable_for.product_a: People who want specialty-grade coffee at home without learning barista skills, capsule switchers, and households where multiple people brew
suitable_for.product_b: Dedicated home baristas who find the process rewarding and want manual control over every variable

not_suitable_for.product_a: Anyone who finds joy in the manual process of making espresso — the Automatico removes the very thing craft baristas love
not_suitable_for.product_b: Anyone who just wants great coffee without the learning curve — the Studio does not forgive inattention

non-barista.rationale: The Automatico gives you caf√©-quality results from day one without requiring any technique — it is the fastest path from capsules to real coffee.

craft-barista.rationale: The Studio's pre-infusion control and manual workflow are the entire point — if you find the process rewarding, the Automatico will feel like a step backward.

office-manager.rationale: In a shared environment where nobody wants to be the designated barista, the Automatico delivers consistent results regardless of who pushes the button.

morning-minimalist.rationale: One button, 60-second heat-up, no separate grinder cluttering the counter — the Automatico is the most streamlined morning workflow we offer.

verdict: This comparison comes down to a single question: do you enjoy making espresso, or do you enjoy drinking it? If the answer is making, the Studio gives you a lifetime of craft to explore. If the answer is drinking, the Automatico gets out of your way and delivers exceptional coffee with almost no effort. Both are excellent machines — they just respect different priorities.
